bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Created in 1971, the United Action Caucus was a rank-and-file organization within the American Federation of Teachers (AFT). It took stands on various issues within the American educational system, supported progressive politics in general and campaigned for internal democracy within the AFT.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials collected and circulated by the United Action Caucus particularly for AFT conventions and conferences. Members of the Communist Party USA are thought to have played an important role in the organization. Document types include by-laws, flyers, newsletters, pamphlets and clippings. The documents span from ca.1975 to ca.1995, and although unprocessed, are neatly arranged in chronological files, with some topical subdivisions.
